e4: Adopting the new policy enhances transparency and aligns with ethical standards, leading to more honest financial reporting. Although it may create short-term confusion among investors, clear communication can overcome this. Moreover, it reduces the risk of legal repercussions and builds long-term trust with stakeholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring that financial statements reflect true performance without intentional bias. It should consider the interests of all stakeholders, including retail investors who rely on truthful information, and proactively communicate any policy changes to prevent misunderstandings, maintaining trust and integrity.
e6: What strategies will be employed to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors? How does the management plan to mitigate potential negative market reactions and protect retail investors during the transition to the unbiased reporting system?
